definition: to rise (i.e. number increases)/a price rise/to raise
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
lit. to ride a crane to Yangzhou (idiom); to get an official position

sentences.english: The broader Standard &Poor's 500 (SPX) index finished just a fraction of a point above Thursday's close.
sentences.chinese: 标准普尔500指数仅仅比周四的收盘价上扬一小点。

sentences.english: But an uptick in output does not augur prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 但是，产量上扬并不预示着经济繁荣。

sentences.english: It was the second straight day of gains and the first back-to-back advance since the middle of June.
sentences.chinese: 6月中旬以来，道指首次连续两天上扬。

sentences.english: But there is potential—albeit uncertain—for gold to go much higher.
sentences.chinese: 但金价是有潜力大幅上扬的，尽管涨势并不确定。

sentences.english: Official statistics also show that the first half year saw rising prices for Beijing's residential houses.
sentences.chinese: 另据统计，今年上半年住宅成交均价呈直线上扬趋势。

sentences.english: With wings, a bird soars in the autumn wind.
sentences.chinese: 只要有翼，当秋风吹起，就能展翅上扬，探索碧空。

sentences.english: Anxiety in the face may be seen with such as eyebrows pulled together in the middle, biting the lip and 'damp eyes'.
sentences.chinese: 焦虑在脸上表现为眉毛往中间上扬，咬唇，眼睛无神。

sentences.english: Silver plummeted to a seven-month low, before rallying slightly.
sentences.chinese: 白银价格创七个月新低，随后小幅上扬。

sentences.english: Asset prices pull themselves up by their own bootstraps.
sentences.chinese: 资产价格上扬全凭己力。

sentences.english: The surge in commodity prices is fueled by China’s demand for speculative inventory.
sentences.chinese: 中国投机性存货引起了大宗商品价格的上扬。

sentences.english: In Singapore, property prices are rising despite the city-state's sharp recession.
sentences.chinese: 在新加坡，房价逆市上扬。

sentences.english: The Franc firmed on the announcement, and remained very steady in Asian trade today.
sentences.chinese: 瑞郎随之上扬，今天亚洲时段保持平稳。

sentences.english: Memories cgreabout make you smile sometimes likewise cry sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 回忆，有时令你嘴角上扬，也能让你喜笑颜开。

sentences.english: The Dow finishes up 50 points, but techs end sharply lower.
sentences.chinese: 道琼斯工业指数上扬50点，而科技股却止于暴跌。

sentences.english: Well, it's a little hard to see, but things tend to take off.
sentences.chinese: 有点难看出来，但是在这里图线是上扬的。

sentences.english: Also, fourth-quarter consumer spending appears to be perking up.
sentences.chinese: 此外，第四季度消费者消费额趋于上扬。

definition: upward/up/to advance/to try to improve oneself/to make progress
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
